bib_record.title: Neutron activation of natural zinc samples at kT=25 keV

free_txt: Activities of the gold foils were measured with
a well calibrated, passively shielded 76 cm3 HPGe
detector, with 1.7 keV resolution at 1.33 MeV gamma-ray
energy and a relative efficiency of 30%.
Zn activities were counted with two clover-type HPGe
detectors facing each other in close geometry. Each
clover detector (Eurisys Measures) consists of four
independent n-type Ge crystals in a four-leaf-clover
arrangement with 0.2 mm gaps in between. The originally
cylindrical crystals of 50 mm diameter, 70 mm length;
active volume of about 145 cm3 per crystal.
Neutron flux was continuously monitored and
recorded in time steps of typically 60 s by means of
6Li-glass detector at 1 m distance from the target.
The individual Ge crystals have resolution of typically
2.0 keV at 1.33 MeV. At 122 keV, the peak-to-total
ratio is about 45 . The efficiency of the clover setup
was determined with a set of pointlike calibration
complemented by a detailed Monte Carlo simulation using
a full model of the setup - see REL-REF of S.Dababneh+.
Proton beam with an energy of Ep = 1912 keV.
30 mu-m thick metallic Li layers evaporated onto
Run  Sample Irradiation time  Integrated flux x10**13
Details of the simulations and the calibration
The samples were sandwiched between 0.03 mm thick gold
foils of the same diameter, which served as neutron
flux monitors. Samples were placed completely inside
the neutron cone in contact with the neutron target at

was obtained by folding the corresponding neutron
spectra, which were calculated with the code PINO with
R.L.Macklin normalized to the value for kT = 25 keV of
Corrections to the measured peak detection efficiency
values for the pointlike calibration sources.
Correction factors compared to ideal pointlike sources
for the clover setup in single mode:
Kext - to the actual diameter of the samples,
Kabs - to gamma-ray absorption in the sample,
Ksum - to the possible summing of cascade transitions.
Uncertainty of gamma-ray intensity for Au.
Uncertainty due to number of Zn-64 nuclei.
Uncertainty due to gamma-ray intensity for Zn.
Uncertainty due to time integrated flux.

Quasistellar neutron spectrum of kT-25 keV.
Error propagation is given in Subent 23166.002
Because statistical uncertainties were found to
be practically negligible after averaging the results
from repeated activations, the final uncertainties are

New value of Zn-71-m HL was measured in this
work from the decay curves of three (386, 487, 620 keV)
gamma transitions in 71Ga to be 4.125 +-0.007 h.
Combining this new result with the values of previous
measurements, weighted average of 4.120+-0.007 h was
